e4: Maintaining the current policy, while seemingly successful, is ethically questionable.  Switching to the new policy establishes transparency and builds trust with investors in the long run. Although a short-term negative market reaction is possible,  the improved ethical standing and potential for increased investor confidence in the long term make the change worthwhile.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency and accuracy, providing a fair and complete picture of the company's financial performance.  It avoids manipulative practices and ensures that all stakeholders have access to the same information.  It should also consider the potential impact on different investor groups and strive for consistency over time to build trust and credibility.  Compliance with relevant accounting standards is paramount.
e6: I would ask the management team to detail their plan to communicate the policy change to investors, including how they will address potential concerns about the initial market reaction.  I would also want to understand their assessment of the potential impact on different investor groups and their strategy to mitigate any negative consequences.
